snippet: Rising revenues from opium trafficking and other such ventures could increase the longevity of the insurgency, Afghan and Western officials say.
abstract: Afghan Taliban are believed to have earned record revenues in 2013 due to bumper opium harvest in Afghanistan and 2014 harvest is forecast to be even better; while insurgents' booming economic ventures contrast with their battlefield difficulties, there is growing concern that Taliban's financial health could extend insurgency in country and complicate efforts to reach peace deal as American-led combat forces withdraw.
lead_paragraph: Rising revenues from opium trafficking and other such ventures could increase the longevity of the insurgency, Afghan and Western officials say.

headline.main: Taliban Run Into Trouble on Battlefield, but Money Flows Just the Same
